Anatomic_Site_of_Lesion: right tongue base, poorly-differentiated squamous cell carcinoma with basaloid features
Pathology_Details: poorly-differentiated squamous cell carcinoma with basaloid features, positive for p16
Patient_Symptoms_at_Presentation: Dysphagia, especially to spicy foods, slight hoarseness of the voice, right otalgia
Treatment_Recommendations: External beam radiotherapy concomitant with chemotherapy, such as cetuximab
Follow_Up_Plans: Patient sent to medical oncology department, audiogram and prophylactic PEG requested, treatment planification within the next weeks
Patient_History_Status_Prior_Conditions: Polyrheumatoid arthritis, arterial hypertension, hypothyroidism, dyslipidemia, macular degeneration
Patient_History_Status_Previous_Treatmen: Actonel, calcium, Synthroid, Metoprolol, Prednisone 5 mg, Vitalux, Vitamin B12, Crestor, Senokot, Ativan
Clinical_Assessments_Radiological_Lesion: CT scan of the neck (report not available), chest x-ray (no active disease), flexible nasopharyngolaryngoscopy (right tongue base lesion measuring 3 cm)
